title: Bing bang boom
creator_credit: Joan Henson, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
brief_description: A novel way of discovering music without instruments, in a Grade 7 classroom. Innovator and Toronto composer R. Murray Shafer is teacher for a day. His purpose is to show children that music is more than painfully learned notes and scales. He has the class listen to every sound around them and then harmonize and orchestrate what they hear - their voices, hands, feet - into a rhythmic musical pattern. The result is a hit, and a convincing illustration that children learn best when it’s from the inside out. Awards: American Film Festival; Sydney.
